description: Pope Leo will embark on his first trip outside Italy as the leader of the Catholic Church on Thursday, traveling to Turkey and Lebanon, where he is expected to make appeals for peace in the region and urge unity among long-divided Christian churches.
title: Pope Leo headed to Turkey and Lebanon for 1st trip abroad as leader of Catholic Church

description: Ottawa and the provinces raked in more than $5.4 billion in cannabis tax revenue since the drug was legalized for recreational use in October 2018.
title: Canada collected over $5.4B in cannabis tax revenue since legalization

description: Brazil's Supreme Court on Tuesday ordered former president Jair Bolsonaro to begin a prison sentence of more than 27 years for plotting a coup in 2022, according to a court document.
title: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro begins serving 27-year prison sentence

description: Newfoundland and Labrador Premier Tony Wakeham says the state of the province’s finances is dire, and believes the deficit is higher than $620 million reported in a fiscal update in August.
title: After ‘poring over’ docs, new N.L. premier says deficit likely higher than previously reported

description: All 24 schoolgirls who were  abducted by armed assailants from a school last week in Kebbi  in northwestern Nigeria have been rescued, the country's president announced Tuesday.
title: Abducted Nigerian schoolgirls rescued, president says

description: Israel on Tuesday said it received human remains that Palestinian militants handed over to the Red Cross, but it was not immediately clear if they were one of three hostages remaining in the Gaza Strip.
title: Israel isn't sure latest human remains returned by Hamas are those of a hostage

description: A lawsuit filed by a former security analyst at Campbell's alleges he was fired for reporting inappropriate conduct by a senior executive, including an hour-long rant in which the executive allegedly called the company's products "s--t for f---ing poor people" in a secret recording.
title: Campbell's exec on leave after allegedly mocking 'poor people' who eat its soup
14 Alberta MLAs are now facing recall drives. Here's how the process works
5 more Alberta UCP legislature members facing recall, bringing total to 14

description: Members of Parliament have revived calls for Canada to criminalize the concept of coercive control as a way of combating intimate partner violence, after a previous bill died when Parliament was dissolved.
title: MPs recommend criminalizing coercive control to combat intimate partner violence
Colleen Jones, champion curler and CBC reporter, dead at 65
Swimmer Penny Oleksiak banned from competition until 2027 as part of anti-doping regulations

description: CBC is launching a new campaign aimed at reminding Canadians how our journalism can provide a safe harbour from the fake news and AI-generated content roiling through our feeds. As the campaign begins, we want to share our updated guidelines for news staff on how we can responsibly use artificial intelligence to the benefit of our journalism and how we can avoid potential pitfalls that may erode public trust.
title: How CBC News will use AI responsibly to benefit our journalism — and keep your trust

description: With Christmas only a month away, many people are getting into the season by taking in holiday markets and tree lighting ceremonies in Canada, the United States and Europe.
title: IN PHOTOS | Magical Christmas markets here and abroad

description: A Manitoba Red Dress Alert program must launch no later than June 2026 and be implemented through an Indigenous-led independent organization, says a report released Tuesday.
title: Indigenous-led Red Dress Alert program must be implemented in Manitoba 'without delay': report

description: Reg Kirby takes a stroll around his old neighbourhood in Kitchener every Remembrance Day. This year, a security camera caught him placing a flag in the lawn of a home in the area and saluting. He says he lived in the home as a child and his annual tradition honours his parents and the sacrifices they made for him and his brother, Kerry.
title: Mystery man who placed flag and saluted Kitchener, Ont., home on Remembrance Day identified

description: U Sports chief executive officer Pierre Arsenault says McGill University's decision to cut 25 sports teams following the 2025-26 season is "unfortunate."
title: McGill University's decision to cut 25 sports teams called 'unfortunate' by U Sports CEO

description: Finance Minister Eric Girard plans to help workers save $1.8 billion over five years through a reduction of contribution rates to the Quebec Pension Plan (QPP) and Quebec Parental Insurance Plan (QPIP).
title: Quebec economic update includes tax breaks for workers, use of Green Fund to tackle debt

description: From infrared thermal cameras to hydrophones, these B.C. residents offered up space on their properties as researchers look to help safeguard marine mammals.
title: Meet the B.C. residents hosting whale detection devices on their properties

description: Jörgen Dance's artistic director and CEO says the moving truck containing set and backdrops, which was allegedly stolen in Etobicoke Monday, has been found. The company had planned to go ahead with its Tuesday show in Burlington regardless.
title: Stolen Nutcracker set recovered, Ontario ballet says

description: The barn owl, one of Canada's most endangered owls, isn't native to Alberta and is considered extremely rare anywhere in the province, which is why wildlife photographers were shocked when one made a surprise appearance in a Calgary park.
title: Endangered barn owl makes 'extremely rare' appearance in Calgary

description: Amid a rash of crimes of violence and extortion, will Mark Carney’s thaw in Canada-India relations help or hurt?
title: Gunshots, arson, threats: B.C’s extortion crisis

description: Environmentalists are concerned that the conditions for approval of the Sisson Mine north of Fredericton were too weak when they were issued in 2015, and now many are a decade out of date.
title: N.B. government says none of 40 Sisson Mine conditions met so far

description: Timestamps on the computer showed that messages were accessed both at home and at school.
title: N.S. mom alarmed after teen targeted by predators on school-issued laptop

description: Russia launched a wave of attacks on Ukraine on Tuesday, killing at least six people in overnight strikes that hit city buildings and energy infrastructure, while a Ukrainian attack in southern Russia killed three people and damaged homes, authorities said. Meanwhile talks aimed at putting a halt to the hostilities were set to take place in Europe and Abu Dhabi.
title: Russian attacks kill at least 6 in Ukraine, as U.S. and Russia diplomats hold talks in Abu Dhabi

description: Russia launched a wave of attacks on Ukraine on Tuesday, killing at least six people in overnight strikes that hit city buildings and energy infrastructure, while a Ukrainian attack in southern Russia killed three people and damaged homes, authorities said.
title: Russian attacks kill at least 6 in Ukraine as U.S. and Russia hold peace talks in Abu Dhabi

description: Asif Mahumud Prince has incurable metastatic thyroid cancer, and doesn't have a permanent resident status in Canada. Now, Prince and his lawyer are fighting for his application to get processed, so he can secure a future for his son.
title: Bangladesh man with little time to live struggling to raise son, access medical care

description: A complaint process is underway for an RCMP officer who arrested an intellectually delayed woman and removed her from a social centre, while off duty and in a different police jurisdiction.
title: Complaint filed about off-duty RCMP officer who arrested woman with intellectual delay

description: Dancing with the Stars recently celebrated its 20th anniversary — but that's not why it's been the talk of Instagram, TikTok, Twitter and, yes, water coolers everywhere this season. Blending nostalgia with a new kind of stardom, the show has successfully reimagined the dance competition for a new generation.
title: How Dancing with the Stars made all the right moves with Gen Z

description: The Siebel Institute of Technology, North America’s oldest brewing school, is moving from Chicago to Montreal in January 2026. The relocation is aimed at improving accessibility for international students and expanding educational programs, including a new baking academy.
title: Prestigious Chicago beer brewing school relocating to Montreal amid U.S. regulatory changes

description: In the first six weeks since Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas reached a truce deal aimed at ending their two-year war, Israeli attacks in Gaza have been reported almost daily.
title: Tracking Palestinian, Israeli deaths since the Gaza ceasefire went into effect
